name: Electrical Wiring Updates & Rewiring
description: The wiring hidden inside your walls is the nervous system of your home—and like any aging system, it eventually needs updating or replacement. Solomon Electric provides comprehensive rewiring and wiring update services for South Florida homes, addressing degraded insulation, aluminum wiring hazards, undersized circuits, and outdated installations. Whether you need complete rewiring or targeted updates to support modern electrical demands, our licensed electricians deliver safe, code-compliant solutions.
warningSignsHeading: Warning Signs Your Home Needs Rewiring
warningSignsSubheading: Electrical wiring doesn't last forever. These signs indicate your wiring may be ready for upgrades or replacement.

problems.title: Home Built Before 1970
problems.description: Homes from this era often have cloth-covered wiring with degraded insulation, creating fire hazards that can't be seen without opening walls.

problems.title: Aluminum Wiring Present
problems.description: Aluminum wiring installed in the 1960s-70s has a documented fire risk due to oxidation and loose connections at terminals. Remediation is strongly recommended.

problems.title: Frequent Breaker Trips
problems.description: Constantly tripping breakers indicate circuits overloaded beyond safe capacity—often because wiring can't handle modern electrical demands.

problems.title: Flickering or Dimming Lights
problems.description: Lights that flicker when appliances turn on indicate insufficient circuit capacity or deteriorating connections somewhere in your wiring.

problems.title: Too Few Outlets
problems.description: Using extension cords and power strips everywhere indicates your home lacks adequate outlets—a common sign of outdated wiring design.

problems.title: Two-Prong Ungrounded Outlets
problems.description: If most of your outlets have only two slots (no ground), your wiring lacks grounding protection—a safety concern that requires updating.

process.title: Comprehensive Assessment
process.description: We examine your existing wiring, panel capacity, and outlet layout to determine whether you need complete rewiring, targeted updates, or aluminum remediation.

process.title: Custom Rewiring Plan
process.description: Based on your needs and budget, we develop a detailed plan covering circuit layout, outlet placement, and any panel upgrades required to support the new wiring.

process.title: Permit Application
process.description: Rewiring requires electrical permits. We handle all permit applications and ensure the work plan meets current Florida electrical code requirements.

process.title: Professional Installation
process.description: Our electricians install new wiring using techniques that minimize wall damage. When possible, we route through attics and crawl spaces to avoid unnecessary drywall cuts.

process.title: Inspection & Completion
process.description: We coordinate the required inspection, ensure all connections are properly made and protected, and provide documentation of the completed work.

benefits.title: Eliminate Hidden Fire Hazards
benefits.description: Degraded wiring insulation and loose connections cause thousands of home fires annually. New wiring eliminates these invisible threats behind your walls.

benefits.title: Support Modern Power Demands
benefits.description: Today's electronics, appliances, and HVAC systems demand more power than 1970s wiring was designed to provide. Updated wiring handles modern loads safely.

benefits.title: Increase Home Value
benefits.description: Updated electrical wiring is a significant selling point. Buyers and home inspectors flag outdated wiring, while modernized systems add value and ease sales.

benefits.title: Insurance Acceptance
benefits.description: Some insurers won't cover homes with aluminum wiring or refuse claims where outdated electrical caused damage. Updated wiring removes these coverage concerns.

faqs.question: How do I know if my house needs rewiring?
faqs.answer: Key indicators include: home built before 1970 (especially with original wiring), aluminum wiring present, cloth-covered wiring visible in attic, frequent breaker trips, flickering lights, two-prong outlets throughout, or warm outlets/switches. We offer assessments to evaluate your wiring condition and recommend appropriate action.

faqs.question: How long does whole-home rewiring take?
faqs.answer: Complete rewiring typically takes 3-5 days for an average home, depending on size, accessibility, and complexity. We can often work room-by-room to minimize disruption, restoring power to each area as it's completed rather than leaving the whole house without power.

faqs.question: Will rewiring require cutting holes in my walls?
faqs.answer: Some wall access is usually necessary, but we minimize this using techniques that route wires through attics, crawl spaces, and existing pathways. When wall cuts are needed, we make them strategically and can recommend drywall repair resources. The safety benefits far outweigh minor repair needs.

faqs.question: Is aluminum wiring really dangerous?
faqs.answer: Aluminum wiring itself isn't inherently dangerous, but its connections to outlets, switches, and breakers develop problems over time. Aluminum oxidizes, expands differently than copper, and requires specific connectors. The documented fire risk comes from these connection points. Remediation options include complete replacement or installing approved aluminum-to-copper connectors (COPALUM or AlumiConn).

faqs.question: Do I need a permit for rewiring?
faqs.answer: Yes. Rewiring is significant electrical work requiring permits from your local building department. Permits ensure work is inspected for safety and creates documentation important for insurance and home sales. Solomon Electric handles all permitting and inspection coordination.

faqs.question: Can I rewire during a renovation?
faqs.answer: Absolutely—renovations are the ideal time for rewiring. With walls already open, we can install new wiring with minimal additional disruption or cost. We coordinate with contractors to ensure electrical work fits the renovation timeline and meets your updated needs.

faqs.question: What type of wire do you use?
faqs.answer: We use copper wiring throughout, typically 12-gauge for 20-amp circuits and 14-gauge for 15-amp circuits. For dedicated circuits (AC, dryer, EV charger), we use appropriate heavier gauge wire. All wiring is NM-B (Romex) rated for residential applications and meets current NEC standards.

faqs.question: Will new wiring add outlets where I need them?
faqs.answer: Yes! Rewiring projects are the perfect opportunity to add outlets where you've always wanted them—home office areas, kitchen islands, workshop spaces, outdoor locations. We design new circuits to serve your actual needs, not just replicate outdated outlet placement.

seoContent.heading: Whole-Home Rewiring Services in South Florida
seoContent.body: Outdated electrical wiring is a ticking clock. Thousands of home fires originate from degraded wiring, loose connections, and overloaded circuits hidden inside walls. Solomon Electric provides comprehensive rewiring services throughout Miami-Dade, Broward, and Palm Beach counties—bringing older homes up to modern safety standards with new copper wiring, properly sized circuits, and code-compliant installations.

seoContent.heading: Aluminum Wiring Remediation
seoContent.body: Homes built in the 1960s and 1970s often contain aluminum wiring—a documented fire hazard at connection points. Insurance companies increasingly require remediation or refuse coverage entirely. Solomon Electric offers both complete aluminum-to-copper rewiring and connection remediation using CPSC-approved COPALUM or AlumiConn connectors when full replacement isn't practical.

seoContent.heading: Rewiring for Renovations
seoContent.body: Planning a kitchen remodel, bathroom update, or home addition? Renovation is the ideal time for rewiring—walls are already open, and you can design electrical to serve modern needs. We coordinate with contractors to install new circuits, add outlets, and upgrade capacity as part of your renovation project.
